benchmark_details.name: Algebraic Combinatorics Dataset Repository (ACD Repo)
benchmark_details.overview: The ACD Repo consists of a collection of 9 datasets representing foundational results or open problems in algebraic combinatorics, designed to support the conjecturing process in mathematics. Each dataset includes an open-ended question and a large collection of examples from which conjectures should be generated.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a range of datasets that are accessible to the broader ML community representing open research-level mathematics problems.

data.source: Datasets generated from mathematical structures in algebraic combinatorics.
data.size: Varied, with some datasets containing up to 10 million examples.
data.format: Text files (.txt) with data instances per line.
data.annotation: Manually generated and tailored to mathematical tasks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model predictions against test labels.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates effective model learning and insight generation.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance benchmarks available in Tables throughout the paper.
methodology.validation: Results validated through performance comparisons of models on the datasets.
